fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39511].
  {panel}

On the [look and feel|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA060/Customising+the+Look+and+Feel#CustomisingtheLookandFeel-Date/TimeFormats] page for date/time formats, it states that this an system wide configuration.

My request is that to put this also as a per project configuration as many users have projects on different timezones and  so they need to use both the AM/PM format and the 24hs format per project.

Best regards.
Diego Zarpelon
Atlassian JIRA Support Engineer
fields.summary: Change Date/time format on a per project basis

fields.description:
Ran into a situation where JIRA exhausted PostgreSQL's connection pool of 75. In the logs we found:
{code}
org.apache.commons.dbcp.AbandonedTrace$AbandonedObjectException: DBCP object created 2014-08-11 08:49:53 by the following code was never closed:
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.AbandonedTrace.setStackTrace(AbandonedTrace.java:139)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.AbandonedObjectPool.borrowObject(AbandonedObjectPool.java:81)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.PoolingDataSource.getConnection(PoolingDataSource.java:106)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.BasicDataSource.getConnection(BasicDataSource.java:1044)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.DBCPConnectionFactory$1.call(DBCPConnectionFactory.java:246)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.DBCPConnectionFactory$1.call(DBCPConnectionFactory.java:243)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.interceptors.connection.ConnectionTracker.trackConnection(ConnectionTracker.java:53)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.DBCPConnectionFactory.trackConnection(DBCPConnectionFactory.java:242)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.DBCPConnectionFactory.getConnection(DBCPConnectionFactory.java:73)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.ConnectionFactory.tryGenericConnectionSources(ConnectionFactory.java:69)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.transaction.JNDIFactory.getConnection(JNDIFactory.java:146)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionFactory.getConnection(TransactionFactory.java:101)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.ConnectionFactory.getConnection(ConnectionFactory.java:59)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.TransactionUtil.beginLocalTransaction(TransactionUtil.java:275)
	at com.atlassian.core.ofbiz.util.CoreTransactionUtil.begin(CoreTransactionUtil.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.jira.transaction.TransactionSupportImpl.beginTxn(TransactionSupportImpl.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.transaction.TransactionSupportImpl.startedTransaction(TransactionSupportImpl.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.transaction.TransactionSupportImpl.begin(TransactionSupportImpl.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.jira.transaction.Txn.begin(Txn.java:20)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.doWorkflowAction(OSWorkflowManager.java:909)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService.transition(DefaultIssueService.java:450)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.CommentAssignIssue.doExecute(CommentAssignIssue.java:192)

{code}
fields.summary: DBCP Connection Leak
Create date between should also consider the end date
REST API: Inactive user isn't returned in search query results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39502].
  {panel}

If you set an issue property as a top level number then it will not be indexed correctly.

Strings and JSON objects work as expected for the record.


For example

PUT localhost:2990/jira/rest/api/2/issue/HELPDESK-2/properties/prop.number

with value 999

correctly sets sets the issue property to 999 but does not index it

so

issue.property[prop.number] = 999

in jql will not work

This is the plugin config I used

{noformat}
  <index-document-configuration
            entity-key="IssueProperty"
            key="sd-ips">
            <key property-key="prop.name">
                <extract path="" type="text" />
            </key>
            <key property-key="prop.object">
                <extract path="characters" type="text" />
                <extract path="numeric" type="number" />
            </key>
            <key property-key="prop.number">
                <extract path="" type="number" />
            </key>
            <key property-key="prop.date">
                <extract path="" type="date" />
            </key>
    </index-document-configuration>
{noformat}
fields.summary: issue property indexing will not index top level numbers or booleans

fields.description:
Problems happens on JIRA startup, in log file I get:
{code}log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger (com.amazonaws.internal.config.InternalConfig).
log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.
log4j:WARN See http://logging.apache.org/log4j/1.2/faq.html#noconfig for more info.{code}

It is caused by:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-38962

If I comment out analytics from bundled plugins pom, problem is gone.
fields.summary: JIRA hangs on AWS SDK warning
Verify JIRA Documentation regarding SQL Server Collation Type
Custom field UI lifecycle management by 3rd party plugins

h3. Steps to reproduce
There isn't any steps known at the moment.

h3. Actual Results
Facing 500 page error while browsing issues

h3. Expected Results
Having a (broken) link without any url value should not cause a 500 page _but_ continue to load and render the Issue View page with warnings that there are errors which can be found in the logs.

h3. Workaround
Restart JIRA

h3. Notes

The while loop in {{DefaultSimpleLinkManager.getLinks}} needs to be hardened against plugin point failures.
One problem this can cause is 500 error while copying field schemes, if a plugin fails.
On the other hand, this class is deprecated, so maybe the right answer is to stop using it and burn it with fire instead of fixing this.
fields.summary: Harden, or remove usages of, DefaultSimpleLinkManager.getLinks

fields.description: Took me a while to work out how long 3,600,000 minutes is :)
fields.summary: Time formatting in message
Provide monthly licensing for server licences
Be able to denote "unimportant" comments in a thread

fields.description:
Error when attempting to upgrade JIRA

h4. Symptoms:

The following appears in JIRA's logs:

{noformat}
2014-08-01 10:33:05,318 main INFO      [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Performing Upgrade Task: Insert sequence for event type
2014-08-01 10:33:05,322 main ERROR      [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Exception thrown during upgrade: Invalid object name 'jiraeventtype'.
java.sql.SQLException: Invalid object name 'jiraeventtype'.
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.SQLDiagnostic.addDiagnostic(SQLDiagnostic.java:368)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.tdsErrorToken(TdsCore.java:2820)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.nextToken(TdsCore.java:2258)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.TdsCore.getMoreResults(TdsCore.java:632)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsStatement.executeSQLQuery(JtdsStatement.java:477)
	at net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.JtdsPreparedStatement.executeQuery(JtdsPreparedStatement.java:776)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:96)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:96)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.util.Sequences.update(Sequences.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build6320.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask_Build6320.java:41)
{noformat}

h4. Cause:

Upgrade tasks that update sequences do not correctly apply schema name to table when the schema is named "jira". This has recently been triggered by an upgrade task in JIRA 6.3, however it's possible it could affect any future upgrade tasks which contain an update to a sequence.

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Install a version of JIRA earlier than JIRA 6.3 on MS SQL Server, making sure that the schema JIRA is installed in is called "jira", and the default schema of the user JIRA connects to MS SQL Server is something other than "jira", for example "dbo" (which is the default). JIRA actually encounters problems if the default schema is not set to "dbo".
# Make sure it's all working fine
# Upgrade to 6.3 or above
# Watch the atlassian-jira.log file for the error above

h4. Workaround:

One of the following works around the issue:

*Option 1*

# Change schema name to something other than "jira". Update the {{dbconfig.xml}} file according to the changes.

*Option 2*

# Stop JIRA
# Change the default schema of the database user JIRA is using to be "jira"
# Start JIRA
# Allow the uprade task to complete - some things in JIRA will be broken such as the streams plugin
# Stop JIRA
# Remove the directories <jira-home>/plugins/bundled-plugins and <jira-home>/plugins/.osgi-plugins
# Change the default schema back to "dbo"
# Start JIRA
# JIRA should be working again

h4. Related Content

This issue appears to be related to [JRA-25270 | https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25270]
fields.summary: Exception thrown during upgrade: Invalid object name 'jiraeventtype'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39485].
  {panel}

On the [Skipping Major Versions When Upgrading JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Skipping+Major+Versions+When+Upgrading+JIRA], its second step states that only user with a JIRA version 3.x or below should go to 4.4.5

However, since JIRA 4.3 introduced a big change (Crowd), our team believe it's safer to upgrade first to 4.4.5.
So my request is to update the KB, hence users will have a safer approach to upgrade their instance. 

Best regards.
Diego Zarpelon
Atlassian JIRA Support Engineer
fields.summary: Update the recommendation for interim upgrade to any version below 4.3 go first to version 4.4.5

fields.description:
The syntax for deleting a user as a watcher on JIRA Issues, via REST API isn't correct on our docs:
- https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#d2e3404

The proper syntax is:
{noformat}
/rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/watchers?username=test
{noformat}
where username that needs to be deleted is 'test'.
fields.summary: REST API docs: syntax for deleting watchers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39478].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

If you access the detail view of an issue or the issue navigator itself, there is no clear content separator, only a different color when you hover the fields/issues.

h3. Expected behaviour

Allow the user to use grid lines separators if he wants to (as it was in older versions).
fields.summary: Allow the user to use grid lines to split content in the detail view and issue navigator as in 4.x versions

fields.description:
In JIRA 6.3.3, there's a new feature that allows users (not administrators) to import issues. However, if you follow the documentation you will not be able to find the option to Import Issues.

JIRA 6.3.3 ships with the JIRA Importers Plugin 6.1.12:

{noformat}
     JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM)                   : com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin
          Version                                       : 6.1.12
          Status                                        : enabled
          Vendor                                        : Atlassian
          Description                                   : A plugin (originally part of JIRA 4.2 and older) which provides capability to import to JIRA issues from 3rd party issue trackers: Bugzilla, FogBugz and Mantis.
{noformat}

In order to view _Import Issues from CSV_ you have to update 'JIRA Importers Plugin' through the Universal Plugin Manager. For that, go to _Administration > Add-Ons > Manage Add-Ons_ and update the JIRA Importers Plugin. It will get you to version 6.2.3:

{noformat}
     JIRA Importers Plugin (JIM)                   : com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-importers-plugin
          Version                                       : 6.2.3
          Status                                        : enabled
          Vendor                                        : Atlassian
          Description                                   : A plugin (originally part of JIRA 4.2 and older) which provides capability to import to JIRA issues from 3rd party issue trackers: Bugzilla, FogBugz and Mantis.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Import Issues from CSV requires add-on update
Make transition buttons on issue view screen stand out better

fields.description:
According to JIRA's keyboard shortcut help menu, 
# The period (.) is for Quick Operations
# The comma (,) is for quick field editing

But when viewing a JIRA issue, either one of them does the same thing. [^QuickAction.jpg]

As per my understanding, the period shortcut should not show the list of fields. (that is the comma shortcut's job)
fields.summary: Period (.) and Comma (,) keyboard shortcuts do the same thing

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the JAVA Opts in setenv.sh or setenv.bat
{code}
-Duser.timezone=Europe/Riga
{code}
# Start JIRA
# Go to due date, entered the value 01.04.1984 
(i) Happens to other date field as well.

h4. Expected behaviour:
The field value accepted by JIRA correctly

h4. Actual Behaviour:
The value is not accepted and prompt error:
{code}
You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d/MMM/yy", eg. "5/Aug/14"
{code}

(i) So far only 1 date affected. Eg. 1/Apr/1984.

h4. Workaround:
* If your OS timezone is Riga:
** Force JVM to run in another timezone that in the same time:
{code}
-Duser.timezone=Europe/Helsinki
{code}
** Switch the OS timezone to another timezone
* In date time field, put date with time e.g: 01.04.1984 01:00 then it works correctly.
fields.summary: Invalid Date Format for Riga timezone

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

When JIRA Agile 6.4.3 is installed on JIRA < 6.3.7, indexing of issues takes an extremely long time. Any edit operation on an issue will take between 5-10 seconds per LexoRank custom field that exists in the system. This happens only when using an Oracle database.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA 6.0 or 6.1
# Install JIRA Agile 6.4.3
# Edit an issue and notice that it takes up to 10 seconds to save
# Run a full reindex and notice that it takes an exceptionally long time. For example if it normally took about a minute to do a full reindex, it might take up to two hours

h4. Diagnosis

# Run the profiling, as in [enabling profiling|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+and+Profiling#LoggingandProfiling-Profiling] documentation
# Create a JIRA issue to reproduce the problem
# Disable profiling log to prevent spamming application log file
# In the atlassian-jira.log, you should see something like the following
{code}
2014-09-01 20:29:05,992 http-bio-2969-exec-5 DEBUG jiraadmin 1228x9018x1 3t9mem 172.22.236.xxx /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [atlassian.util.profiling.UtilTimerStack] [21376ms] - /ghs-12926/secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa
  [0ms] - PermissionManager.hasPermission()
  [21373ms] - QuickCreateIssue.execute()
    [28ms] - PermissionManager.getProjects()
    [0ms] - List.contains()
    .....
    [17057ms] - IssueIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects()
    .....
{code}
See the {{IssueIndexManager.reIndexIssueObjects()}} spiking to *17s*

h4. Notes

This is caused by a bug in Active Objects tracked in [AO-549|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AO-549] - note that this issue only affects the Oracle database.
fields.summary: Issue indexing is very slow when JIRA Agile 6.4.3 or higher is installed on Oracle database

fields.description:
When trying to create a new component (component field set as required) in the _Create Issue_ screen, an error saying 'Component/s is required' shows even though a new component is already selected.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the component field as required
# Create a new issue
# Enter a new component name (eg. Component 5) and select *Component 5 (New Component)* from the dropdown list
# Click the _Create_ button

h5. Actual Outcome
# Error saying "Component/s is required'
# Issue not created
!component.png|thumbnail!

h5. Expected Outcome
# Issue is created and a new component is created

h5. Additional information
# If the component field is not set as required, the issue and the new component will be created without any errors
fields.summary: Unable to create new (required) component during issue creation

fields.description:
The refresh icon at the top results in Issue Navigator is missing or not rendered. The refresh icon at the bottom of the results is still showing normally. I have made comparison with JIRA 6.3.1 and JIRA 6.2.4 where the later have the refresh icon on both top and bottom.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Set up JIRA 6.3.1
# Create Demo project
# Go to Issue Navigator

h4. Screenshot
!Selection_010.png!

h4. Expected results
To have the refresh icon on top and bottom of the page. As per the example image shown in our documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+Issue+Navigator].
fields.summary: Refresh Icon Missing in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
The atlassian-plugin.xml file starts like
{noformat}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<at:atlassian-plugin key="${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}"
                     name="${project.name}" plugins-version="2"
                     xmlns:at="http://www.atlassian.com/schema/plugins"
                     xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
                     xsi:schemaLocation=" http://www.atlassian.com/schema/plugins http://www.atlassian.com/schema/plugins">
    <at:plugin-info>
...
{noformat}

This does not cause problems with "atlas-mvn clean install" but with "atlas-remote-test" I get the following error message on the server:

{noformat}
UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-2 WARN admin 571x1027x1 ms1evq 127.0.0.1 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [upm.core.install.DefaultPluginInstallationService] Plugin installation failed: Invalid atlassian-plugin.xml descriptor
{noformat}

Can you clarify (for example in some documentation) if xml namespaces are allowed or not and also make the behavior consistent.
fields.summary: atlassian-plugin.xml with a namespace prefix fails with UPM

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a minimum, standalone OpenSocial gadget that contains at least one <UserPref>, and host the xml on a web server
# Add the gadget to a Jira dashboard
# Open the Edit dialog

Expected: UserPrefs are visible and editable in the configuration GUI

Actual: No config GUI opens

This is a regression. The exact same gadget works for me in 5.2.5, but fails in 6.3

The issue has been discussed in https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/291779/edit-of-open-social-gadget-doesn-t-work, but I was not able to locate an existing bug report for it. This problem blocks our planned upgrade from 5.x to 6.x.

1. View issue page

3. Click on the little permanent link icon to the right of the comment

fields.description:
The classloader can not load classes within com.sun when using the new Scheduler API from 6.3. The old PluginScheduler has stopped working since JIRA 6.3 as well. Why I'm requesting this classes is because of the LDAP implementation in the JRE.

bq.  Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory

When requesting the same components from a REST-API it works fine, but when firing from the Scheduler it doesn't work. I've been playing around with classloaders etc but haven't got it to work. 

Is this a bug? If not, what do I have to do to make it work with your changes in JIRA 6.3, I can't find any documentation for this change in the docs.

Cheers //M
fields.summary: The new Scheduler API in JIRA 6.3 and LDAP

issueTypeManager.createIssueType("NAME", "DESCRIPTION", ComponentAccessor.getAvatarManager().getDefaultAvatarId(Avatar.Type.ISSUETYPE));

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39435].
  {panel}

When adding a comment via email, if you cc anyone else, they are not added as Watchers. This is the case even if they are a valid JIRA user.

Steps to reproduce.
# Open up an Issue via Email and have cc'd a valid JIRA user in the email.
# The issue will be created in JIRA with the cc'd user added as a Watcher to the Issue. *This part works.*
# Once you get an email from the Issue, do a reply all.
# Next, add a new, valid JIRA user to the cc field of the email. 
# When the Issue updates, JIRA does not add the new user to the Watchers list.

Currently, this feature only works when the issue was created, and not when it's being commented. I can see this on the original feature was intended to work this way: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-9983

The customer believes adding a cc'd user to the Watchers list from the Comment function is a logical progression from the adding a cc'd user to the Watchers list from the Create function which has already been implemented.
fields.summary: Adding a cc'd User to the Watchers List from the Comment Function

fields.description:
Bug:
When creating an Issue Collector in JIRA and adding the "Affects Version/s" field to it, the dropdown feature does not work in this field.

How to reproduce error:
1. Create an Issue Collector in a JIRA project.
2. Click to add the "Affects Version/s" field to the template, and Update the Issue Collector.
3. Add this Issue Collector to a page for testing by embedding the generated javascript.
4. From that page, click on the trigger to open the webapp.
5. Click on the dropdown option in the "Affects Version/s" field.
(No values will display when clicking the dropdown arrow, and an unusual box will appear at the bottom of the window.)

Notes:
This seems to be the same issue once resolved in JRA-32262. Though there are claims that the bug has been fixed with the release of JIRA v6.1.1, it seems it has resurfaced in JIRA v6.1.3. Please help, and thank you.
fields.summary: "Affects Version/s" dropdown error in Issue Collector and template

fields.description:

  {panel}

*Problem*: When preforming a *Bulk Change* on _Transition Issue_ when a radio button/check box is a custom field on the screen, selecting an option of the radio button custom field doesn't enable the field, only the option.

*Duplication Steps*:
- Add Radio Button/Check Box as a Custom Field
- Add the Radio Button/Check Box Custom Field screen association to an issue transition.
- Preform Bulk Change for Transition Issue (use the transition for associated with the Radio Button/Check Box Custom Field)
- Select the option for the custom field
-- *Radio Button/Check Box doesn't check when option is selected outside of 'None'*

*Note*:
- Only occurs with *Transition Issue* Bulk Change

!radio-button-screen.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Radio button/check box not enabling when preforming bulk Transition Issue

Here are the steps to try to reproduce this bug, You might have an issue with Chrome since each tab is seen as it's own sandbox. Firefox is the browser this is accurring on. 

A. Query filter 1 and got xx issues.
B. Opened a new browser tab and query filter 2 and get yy issues listed.
C. Go back to the first browser tab and choose Tools/Bulk Change. It shows xx issues.
D. Click on "all xx issue(s)"
E. The Bulk Change process presents you with the issues from the second filter with yy number of issues.

Filters I was using was:
Filter one : project=otm and created > -1d
Filter two: project=tsg and created > -1d

This seems to happen when you do the search with in 60 seconds ( must be cache )

Under Custom Fields, an admin clicked Configure on a field. Click the delete (garbage can) on a context. There is no confirmation prompt. The field and all values are deleted from ALL issues for that project. There is no Undo button, no description in the Log file.
This just happened to us. The business is unhappy to loose all the data from project.

A prompt saying "Are you sure you want to delete this context? The action cannot be undone.'

Even better, a detailed record in the log file about what was done with a revert option.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Jira Server*. Using *Jira Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39413].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When searching for issues in Jira in the issue navigator, it is possible to see at a column that indicates this issue is linked to another issue and see that issuekey. However the issue navigator is not currently able to show the end users what kind of link this is. This is important information to have in the context of understanding how issues relate to each other in Jira.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if the issue navigator could add an additional column that could then show end users not only the link issuekey, but also the link type that this other issue has with the issue in question in Jira. Taking into account that Jira issues can have multiple linked issues of various types.
h3. Why this is important

Transparency in data, ease of use, helping users more quickly and easily understand how issues relate to each other in Jira
h3. Workaround

None

 
{panel:title=Original Request|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#3c7833|titleBGColor=#42aaf5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Currently users can configure the Issue Navigator to show a column for linked issues, but they can only see the issue keys of these linked issues.

It's great if users can also see the link type of the linked issues in Issue Navigator.
{panel}
fields.summary: Display Link Type column in Issue Navigator search results
https://ops.atlassian.com/jira/browse/HOT-11628

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39411].
  {panel}

Currently when deactivating a user, it treats them as deactivated rather than a new user. This can be problematic in the following use case:

* Instance is configured with unlimited license.
* Moves to a small license.
* Users are deactivated to meet new license requirements.
* They cannot create mail as anonymous users, as when the mail handler goes to match mail it matches them to a deactivated account.

To put it another way, an external staff member who was hired today is able to email the JIRA email address and create issues and comments anonymously, but an external staff member who has been around for a while and used to have a JIRA account cannot. From an instance point of view, it can be considered that there aren't any difference between these two staff members – both have no current JIRA presence and could be treated exactly the same way (i.e. they should not be allowed to log into JIRA or create issues under their own name, but should be allowed to create issues anonymously via email).
fields.summary: Treat deactivated users as anonymous when creating mail in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39409].

I am using Jira On Demand. In the workflow admin area there is a link to a "best practices" guide. When I click on the link I get the message "Page level restrictions apply to this page. These restrictions limit access to specific users or groups."

The link URL that displays this message is:

 https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Best+practice+for+automated+transitions?utm_campaign=yuX3vawa&utm_medium=navbar&utm_source=inproduct

I am logged-in to https://confluence.atlassian.com with username dhughes@bear-code.com. The link is appearing on this screen:
 
https://aprexis.atlassian.net/secure/admin/workflows/ViewWorkflowTransition.jspa?atl_token=B57Z-B3LS-SEOV-3W52|c3079dee12eff2d29b6a11fb28e0afca4a453743|lin&workflowMode=draft&workflowName=Rails+App+workflow&project=10300&workflowStep=8&workflowTransition=741

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39388].
  {panel}

The text under Summary reads:

_Welcome to the administration of your demonstration project!_
_This is where you can view and change how the project is configured. Use the tabs on the left to navigate to different project settings._

However, we're not in Administration.
fields.summary: Welcome text on Project Summary is actually the 'welcome to administration' text
Plugins that I did not install or request are showing up under 'User-installed add-ons' in administration
Documentation for QA process tests

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39384].
  {panel}

Currently one can access an issue from 2 ways:
* jira.example.com/browse/KEY-123
* jira.example.com/issues/KEY-123

From both ways the issue is displayed, however, when one access it from jira.example.com/issues/KEY-123, the URL "redirects" to jira.example.com/issues, but the issue still is being displayed. And when one tries to comment on the issue one receives a "Communications Breakdown" error.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA issue
# You can either access it directly then change "browse" to "issues" on the URL of the browser, or from the link jira.example.com/issues/KEY-123 (just adjust the pattern to your case)
# Add a comment to the issue
fields.summary: "Communications Breakdown" when commenting on issue from /issues/KEY-123
Allow the usage of custom backup directories
Enhanced integration between JIRA and AD
More flexible and customizable Release Notes supporting Epics
Upload Avatar Window - Screen Resolution Issue
Update SQL Server documentation for integrated authentication
Update SQL Server documentation for named instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39375].
  {panel}

Since JQL functions work as macros, whenever they return a big list JIRA needs to go through the whole list and validate the interim results before proceeding with the query.
Even though query is limited by other clauses, but JQL doesn't have smarts and calculates the context, even though a much more restricted context is provided by another clause.
Some improvements have been made to reduce the pain by batching and doing less work, but it doesn't scale beyond 100-200K issues.
We need to provide means to functions to override some of this behaviour.

h4. Partial fix 
First step to address this problem was done in JRASERVER-63665
JIRA prepares a search with a small limit set (_1000_) and check if _totalHits_ is bigger. If it's bigger then we do a second search and we exactly know the limit now (_totalHits_ from the previous search). 

h5. Additional logging 
Additional logs can help to find a plugin which is doing such searches. To enable this:
* Set {{com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers.LuceneSearchProvider}} to _DEBUG_ level to capture expensive JQLs: 
** It logs only queries which try to fetch more than 1000 documents. 
** Example of the logging:
{noformat}
"Search for the query <> was performed and results count <> exceeds max allowed search limit 
Large result sets could lead to OutOfMemoryError. If you're sure you need to do the query you can remove the limit by enabling feature."

or 

"Search for the query [<>] was performed and results count (<>) exceeds default limit"
{noformat}
fields.summary: Enable JQL functions to opt out of heavy processing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39370].
  {panel}

Could you please update the installation instructions of [PostgreSQL on Ubuntu|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+up+a+PostgreSQL+Database+on+Linux+for+JIRA?utm_source=SAC&utm_medium=dashboard].

*Remove:*
user:~$ sudo apt-get install postgresql-8.2 postgresql-client-8.2 (doesn't work anymore)

*Replace by:*
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get upgrade 
sudo apt-get install postgresql postgresql-contrib

I've tested on my end and worked properly.
fields.summary: Update JIRA Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39368].
  {panel}

Could you please create a mechanism to improve the spam protection on comments section for public JIRA instances? Unfortunately some instances needs to be public and we're seeing some bots causing spam on those instances.

You may refer the instances below as example:
https://jira.spring.io/browse/ROO-3402
http://jira.phoenixviewer.com/browse/FIRE-12502
http://www.crosswire.org/tracker/browse/BCS-69
https://issues.jasig.org/browse/CAS-1447

Furthermore if you google for "Search Engine xrk3tw9o fantastic" you'll find more than 100 results of SPAM caused by a bot.

Thank you!
Luciano Fagundes
fields.summary: Improve spam protection in comments
Limit "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue" email handler to configured project
Email notifications not sent to nested group members

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39365].
  {panel}

Currently, the Issue Collector doesn't allow use of a number of fields in JIRA. It seems mainly to be since they are not allowed to be accessed by anonymous requests, per [Using the Issue Collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+Issue+Collector]:
- Not all fields of types of fields can be added to the form, since some fields cannot be displayed to anonymous users. The fields types that can be displayed are:
-- Standard Fields: Summary, Description, Components, AffectsVersion, Environment, Priority, Attachment
-- Custom Field Types: Date Time, Radio Buttons, Multi-Checkbox, Multi-Select, Number, Select List, URL field, Version Picker, Cascading Select, Project Picker, Single Version Picker, Text Field, Free Text Field

This issue was created to investigate/consider the possibility of extending the Issue Collector to make use of functionality which is only available to authenticated users.
fields.summary: Extend Issue Collector to make use of authenticated resources
Prevent agile work mode board from jumping/scrolling to assigned user when assigning an issue
Cannot filter by version picker custom field for more than one project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39362].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour 

JIRA only supports Crowd for SSO.

h3. Expected Behaviour

SAML2 support for JIRA to handle external users together with Crowd.

Please see the following ticket for reference: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-199882
fields.summary: JIRA Support for SAML2
We should improve the Webhooks logging
GitHub import ignores changes on already importe issues

fields.description:
When you browse to Issue Navigator, JIRA will throw a REST call to retrieve the subscription details of every favorite filter that you might have.

h4. Environment
JIRA 6.4.11

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA
# Create and subscribe into a few more filters (optional)
# Navigate to *Issue Navigator* page

h4. Expected Results
JIRA will not try to retrieve the subscription details of your favorite filters; Issue Navigator will be displayed as usual.

h4. Actual Results
JIRA will call for {{rest/api/2/filter/favourite?expand=subscriptions\[-5:\]&_=1406622755881}} and retrieve the subscription details of every favorite filter that you might have. On first access, it adds *2.7s* load time to open *Issue Navigator* page. This adds a lot of overhead and the information is not used anywhere on the screen when you first open it.
!filter.png|thumbnail!

h4. Notes
This could be removed to improve page load times.

h4. Workaround

No available workaround.
fields.summary: Favourite filters REST Resource is needlessly retrieving subscriptions on Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39357].
  {panel}

Hi,
I'm in AtlasDesk, working on the ADM project.

Sometimes, we solve an issue so fast (within a few minutes), the statuses change in a normal order: from Unassign -> In Progress -> Resolved, ... 

But the user got the notification emails in a wrong order, because we were too fast to solved it (around 2 mins - as we experienced).

Please let me know if you want more details or need a real case to look at.
Regards,
Phong Thai
fields.summary: Notification emails NOT coming in the right order

fields.description:
Scenario:
Make a JQL search
Scroll through and look at some issues
Carry on work in another window
Suddenly, JQL search shows no issues, see screenshot
Redo the search and the issues are there

Is this due to Datacenter nodes maybe?
fields.summary: JAC search results seem to disappear after some time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-39355].
  {panel}

From the documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Deletingauser], it is not possible to delete a user if:
* reported or been assigned to any issues
* commented on any issues

Most of the time, users have done one of the above actions, and deleting them is not possible. Therefore it is always recommended for the users to be deactivated.
fields.summary: Recommend Deactivate User instead of Deleting User
Search for comments from a particular user
